actions.args: {"id": 16, "body": {"name": "Aeon: permissionless multi-sig for NEAR", "summary": "At Aeon, we\\\\\\'re building the first multi-chain multi-sig for custody of any asset on any chain. We use decentralized MPC, enable permissionless onboarding of chains and DeFi services, and offer sophisticated transaction policies down to the payload level. Our vision: become the hub for multi-chain DeFi and provide an AI agent marketplace for outsourcing work like reporting, trading strategies, and risk management.", "category": "Infrastructure Committee", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": null, "description": "### Primary person\\\\u{2019}s contact information\\\\nJustin Heinz(justin@aeon.so)\\\\n\\\\n### Size of the whole team\\\\n4\\\\n\\\\n### Size of the engineering team\\\\n3 (+2 starting in Q4)\\\\n\\\\n### Team location\\\\nLisbon, Portugal\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Team background and bios\\\\n\\\\n* Justin - Co-Founder (https://www.linkedin.com/in/justin-alexander-heinz/, https://github.com/fl0ydj): studied at Cambridge, worked at Amazon, built wallet for Outlet finance; prev. founder experience\\\\n* Alex - Co-Founder (https://www.linkedin.com/in/alexander-ludwig-profile/, https://github.com/alexanderludwig): start-up experience in data science; VC for EQT ventures\\\\n* Parshant - Founding Engineer (https://www.linkedin.com/in/psm21/, https://github.com/singhparshant): IIIT Allahabad/ TUM, Goldman Sachs; MPC research at UCL\\\\n* 2 engineers starting in Q4\\\\n* freelance designer\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Product / Value Proposition\\\\n\\\\nBuilding a trustless and permissionless multi-sig for the Near ecosystem, to make it easier for sophisticated investors to hold tokens and interact with Near\\\\u{2019}s DeFi protocols.\\\\nProduct demo: https://www.loom.com/share/270c39a0d9044d59b555dfa04a24e501\\\\n* Allowing trustless custody of any asset on any chain by leveraging Pera\\\\\\'s (formerly dWallet network) decentralized & non-collusive MPC. (Find more details here: https://github.com/dwallet-labs/dwallet-network, https://eprint.iacr.org/2024/253.pdf)\\\\n* Permissionless onboarding of new chains, so ecosystems can onboard themselves in a self-service manner. Existing ecosystem integrations include Bitcoin, EVM, Cosmos, Sui, and Fuel.\\\\nOffers sophisticated transaction policies down to the payload level (e.g., allowing limits on swapping, lending, and borrowing amounts) and other features like user management, address book, and trustless recovery (with a Ledger).\\\\n* Access dApps through our dApp store ecosystem in a secure manner, safeguarded by our policy engine.\\\\nInstitutional-grade security, with part of the key secured by Pera\\\\\\'s decentralized MPC network and the other part by our mobile signing app using the mobile phone\\\\\\'s secure enclave.\\\\n* Integration of chain abstraction and chain-abstracted DeFi services into our product.\\\\n* Product vision: Become a platform for AI agents that users can hire to execute tasks for them, such as executing sophisticated trading strategies (e.g., going long on revenue-generating DeFi projects, shorting infrastructure projects), and advising users on proper risk management techniques. Here we see synergies with NEAR\\\\\\'s strategy and hence would want to integrate such projects and work closely together with them.\\\\n\\\\n### Benefits for the NEAR ecosystem\\\\n* Integration of NEAR into a multi-chain custody solution with policy engine support (NEAR token holders can restrict sender, receiver, and amount of assets being transferred). This increases accessibility of NEAR assets for institutional and sophisticated investors (market makers, liquid/venture funds, sophisticated teams/individuals) to hold assets. The product will be gradually made open-source over the next years.\\\\n* Integration of NEAR multi-chain DeFi projects to be used directly by sophisticated investors from within our product (e.g., swapping and lending).\\\\n* Integration of NEAR AI agents into our platform to offer our customers services provided by these agents.\\\\n\\\\n### Goals / Milestones\\\\n\\\\n**NEAR integration (Target: Q4 2024)**\\\\n* Mainnet launch in Q4 2024, dependent on Pera network\\\\n* Integration of the NEAR RPC API into our chain integration SDK to communicate with and read transactions from the NEAR blockchain\\\\n* Completion of security audits for our core smart contracts and the NEAR transaction assembling module (written in Move)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n**dApp integration (Q1 2025)**\\\\n* Integration of NEAR ecosystems into our integrated dApp store (as described here: https://x.com/ilblackdragon/status/1821933128799211618)\\\\n* Incorporation of the NEAR wallet selector into our multi-chain extension framework\\\\n \\\\n### Metrics\\\\n**Milestone 1: NEAR integration**\\\\n* Users can hold assets on NEAR and execute transfers of the NEAR native asset, NEP-141 fungible token standard, and NEP-171 non-fungible token standard.\\\\n\\\\n**Milestone 2: dApp integration**\\\\n* Users can natively use the top 10 NEAR dApps through our dApp interface.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Competitor Comparison\\\\n\\\\n#### Alternatives:\\\\n* On-chain multi-sigs (e.g., Gnosis Safe, Squads): Suffer from fragmentation across chains and lack support for non-smart contract chains. However, for NEAR, there is no native multi-sig available offering the same features as Aeon does.\\\\n* MPC-based institutional custody players (e.g., Fireblocks): Slow to innovate, permissioned, closed source, not built from the ground up for DeFi interactions, and expensive.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n#### Our Advantages:\\\\n* Built for DeFi & AI agents: Manage all your positions within our platform.\\\\n* Ability to hire AI agents constrained by the policy engine built for DeFi.\\\\n* Institutional-grade security: Truly decentralized and censorship-resistant. Transactions are cosigned by the user\\\\\\'s mobile phone enclave and a decentralized network.\\\\n\\\\n### Usage & Examples\\\\n\\\\nCurrent testnet launch with 10 investors testing our product. Integration with BTC, EVM, Cosmos, Sui, Fuel. See product demo above.\\\\n\\\\n## Budget\\\\n\\\\n### Budget Total\\\\n\\\\n$62k\\\\n\\\\n### Budget Breakdown\\\\n#### Milestone 1: Near integration $41k\\\\n* Engineering costs smart contract signing module in Move: $14k\\\\n* Smart contract audits: $8k\\\\n* Integration into Aeon chain SDK abstracting Near RPC: $11k\\\\n* Setting up and maintaining subquery indexer: $8k\\\\n \\\\n#### Milestone 2: dApp integration $21k \\\\n* Javascript extension injection flow enabling dApps to connect with Aeon using the Near wallet selector $12k\\\\n* Extend Aeon chain SDK to support Near dApp request processing $9k\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "0xalxx.near", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "62000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Other"]}

{"id": 14, "body": {"name": "NEARWeek: NEAR-STAKING.COM INFRASTRUCTURE UPGRADE PROPOSAL", "summary": "This proposal seeks to upgrade the infrastructure and enhance the accuracy of staking rewards and balance displays on near-staking.com, a vital platform in the NEAR ecosystem. Managed by NEARWEEK AG, the experienced team aims to improve data reliability and service uptime over a 1-year period. The project, requiring $5,000 USD monthly (totaling $60,000), will involve backend/frontend updates and infrastructure enhancements to meet ecosystem needs and stakeholder feedback.", "category": "Infrastructure Committee", "timeline": {"status": "APPROVED", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "linked_rfp": null, "supervisor": "trechriron71.near", "description": "\\\\n# Overview\\\\n\\\\nThis proposal outlines the plan for upgrading the infrastructure and quality of staking rewards and balances displayed to the NEAR ecosystem on [near-staking.com](https://near-staking.com).\\\\n\\\\n## Organisation\\\\n\\\\nNEAR-Staking is a part of NEARWEEK, operated by NEARWEEK AG, based in Zug, Switzerland.\\\\n\\\\n### Primary Contact Information\\\\n\\\\n- **Name:** DenysK\\\\n- **Email:** denys@nearweek.com\\\\n- **NEAR ID:** denysk.near \\\\n\\\\n### Team Details\\\\n\\\\n- **Total Team Size:** 3\\\\n- **Engineering Team Size:** 3\\\\n- **Team Locations:** Portugal, Estonia & Ukraine\\\\n\\\\n## Team Background, Bios & NEAR Experience\\\\n\\\\nDenys K, a NEAR OG with 3+ years of NEAR developer experience, is the CTO of NEARWEEK and the original creator of the near-staking.com platform. The team includes a senior front-end developer and a senior back-end developer. Their work includes:\\\\n\\\\n- [heroes.build application](https://heroes.build)\\\\n- NEARWEEK BOS widgets\\\\n- Various Github, Telegram & Twitter bots\\\\n\\\\n### Examples of Relevant Experience with NEAR Blockchain\\\\n\\\\n- [Near-Staking.com](https://near-staking.com/)\\\\n- [SputnikDAO](https://nearweek.github.io/sputnik-dao-2-ui-reference-mainnet/#/genesis.sputnik-dao.near)\\\\n- Lockup contract and UI\\\\n- Multisig UI\\\\n- Various BOS components: \\\\n  - [NearStats](https://dev.near.org/denysk.near/widget/NearStats)\\\\n  - [PriceStats](https://near.social/denysk.near/widget/PriceStats)\\\\n\\\\n### Affiliations with Other NEAR Ecosystem Partners\\\\n\\\\nNEARWEEK is the official newsletter of the NEAR ecosystem, collaborating with major NEAR stakeholders and cross-chain platforms like Messari, Coingecko, and CoinmarketCap.\\\\n\\\\n## Professional Experience\\\\n\\\\nThe team has 10+ years of full-stack experience, including Java and C++, and 2 years of experience with Rust for the NEAR blockchain, alongside JavaScript and React for frontend development.\\\\n\\\\n### Non-Technical Capabilities\\\\n\\\\nNEARWEEK has a large team focused on marketing, social media, and design, but these will not be relevant to the near-staking project, which is primarily a development effort.\\\\n\\\\n## Motivation for the Proposal\\\\n\\\\nIn the blockchain industry, especially on proof-of-stake blockchains, a thriving validator ecosystem is crucial for a transparent and tamper-proof decentralized ledger. Accurate real-time data on validator uptime and staking rewards is essential. Near-staking.com has provided this service for over 3 years, receiving valuable feedback from the ecosystem. This proposal aims to upgrade the near-staking infrastructure based on that feedback. We have adjusted our initial proposal based on the IC feedback, please find the thread [here](https://github.com/near/Infrastructure-Working-Group/discussions/129)\\\\n\\\\n### Building Blocks of Near-Staking.com\\\\n\\\\n- **Near-Staking Rewards and Balances** - Review and confirm data reliability.\\\\n- **Validator Dashboard**\\\\n- **NEAR Private RPC Node**\\\\n- **NEAR Fastnear Indexer** - Significantly upgrade underlying server infrastructure.\\\\n\\\\n### Required Technical Expertise\\\\n\\\\n- Senior Rust Developer\\\\n- Mid/Senior Frontend Developers\\\\n- UI Designer\\\\n- Senior DevOps/Validator\\\\n- Database Engineer\\\\n\\\\nAll required resources are available in-house.\\\\n\\\\n## Goals / Milestones\\\\n\\\\nThe proposal covers a 1-year period, including specific infrastructure upgrades and general maintenance. Key milestones include:\\\\n\\\\n- **Upgrade NEAR indexer server infrastructure** (1 month of backend/frontend work)\\\\n- **Analyze reliability of rewards & balances data** (2 months of QA work)\\\\n- **Push required updates** based on findings (up to 2 months of frontend & backend implementation)\\\\n\\\\n### Metrics\\\\n\\\\n- **Uptime of near-staking service:** Target 95% uptime.\\\\n- **Precision of staking rewards & balances data:** Aim for up to 0.5% accuracy, with potential for 0.1% inaccuracies in specific cases.\\\\n\\\\n## Competitor Comparison\\\\n\\\\nSince [NEAR Validators](https://pages.near.org/about/network/validators/) has been discontinued, the following projects offer complementary services:\\\\n\\\\n- **[Nearblocks.io](https://nearblocks.io/):** A block explorer that provides different data, not specializing in accurate staking rewards & balances.\\\\n- **[Pikespeak.ai](https://pikespeak.ai/):** A data platform for the NEAR ecosystem with explorer capabilities and data dashboards but does not specialize in accurate staking rewards & balances.\\\\n- **[Nearscope.net](https://nearscope.net/):** Similar to near-staking, but lacks reliable transaction-based rewards data. Provides historical network performance graphs, which near-staking does not.\\\\n\\\\n## Budget\\\\n\\\\nWe request $5,000 USD equivalent per month over a 1-year period, totaling $60,000 USD equivalent. The detailed budget breakdown is as follows:\\\\n\\\\n### Budget Breakdown\\\\n\\\\n| Category                                                                                      | Monthly Cost USD equivalent |\\\\n|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------|\\\\n| Indexer, Infrastructure & AWS S3 Costs, external RPC service and Near-Staking Hosted server    | $1,500                     |\\\\n| Front-End, Back-End, QA & On-Call DevOps                                                      | $3,500                      |\\\\n\\\\n| **Total monthly budget**                                                                       | **$5,000**                  |\\\\n```\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "summoners.near", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "60000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Other"]}

{"data": {"infrastructure-committee.near": {"index": {"notify": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"summoners.near\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"proposal/edit\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"proposal\\\\\\\":14,\\\\\\\"widgetAccountId\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"infrastructure-committee.near\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"notifier\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"trechriron71.near\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

{"id": 13, "body": {"name": "Read-RPC development support", "summary": "This proposal seeks to continue the development of read-rpc as an open-source project, focusing on compensating the two primary developers working on it.", "category": "Infrastructure Committee", "timeline": {"status": "APPROVED", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "linked_rfp": null, "supervisor": "trechriron71.near", "description": "# Read-RPC development support\\\\n\\\\n## Organization\\\\n\\\\n### Primary person\\\\\\'s contact information\\\\nEvgeny Kuzyakov (ek at fastnear.com)\\\\n\\\\n### Size of the whole team\\\\n3 developers\\\\n\\\\n### Size of the engineering team\\\\n3 developers\\\\n\\\\n### Team location\\\\nRemote\\\\n\\\\n### Team background and bios\\\\n\\\\n- Evgeny Kuzyakov (https://github.com/evgenykuzyakov)\\\\n- Bohdan Khorolets (https://github.com/khorolets) \\\\n- Yurii Koba (https://github.com/kobayurii)\\\\n\\\\n## Professional Experience\\\\n\\\\n- Development and maintenance of read-rpc (https://github.com/near/read-rpc)\\\\n- Development and serving of the alternative indexing solution at FASTNEAR, e.g. https://mainnet.neardata.xyz (https://github.com/fastnear/neardata-server/)\\\\n\\\\n## Body\\\\nThe read-rpc project aims to provide a centralized RPC solution for serving read-only requests for NEAR blockchain data. It mimics the json-rpc client from nearcore while supporting archival data and maintaining fast response times with low latency. This proposal seeks to continue the development of read-rpc as an open-source project, focusing on compensating the two primary developers working on it.\\\\n\\\\nKey benefits of continuing read-rpc development in open-source:\\\\n1. Improved access to NEAR blockchain data for developers and applications\\\\n2. Enhanced performance for read-only operations\\\\n3. Support for archival data\\\\n4. Open-source nature promotes transparency and community involvement\\\\n\\\\nThe project development and documentation will remain under the MIT or Apache2 License.\\\\n\\\\n## Goals / Milestones\\\\n\\\\n- Continious improvement of read-rpc functions.\\\\n- Release of the read-rpc with postgres database support (transitioning from ScyllaDB).\\\\n- Extensive documentation on how to setup read-rpc node from scratch.\\\\n- Ability to sync read-rpc database from alternative indexing sources like neardata.xyz instead of NEAR Lake Framework.\\\\n- 1 year development supoprt of the read-rpc, to maintain parity with the original json-rpc client from nearcore.\\\\n\\\\n## Metrics\\\\n- Requests per second benchmarks.\\\\n- Database size and hardware requirements.\\\\n- Query response time: Measure and maintain low latency for read operations\\\\n- Number of unique users/applications utilizing read-rpc\\\\n- Community engagement: Track GitHub stars, forks, and contributions\\\\n\\\\n## Usage & Examples\\\\n- Current users: Pagoda RPC service\\\\n- Usage metrics: unavialble\\\\n\\\\n## Budget\\\\n### Budget Total\\\\n$220,000 USD per year\\\\n\\\\n### Budget Breakdown\\\\n- Developer compensation: $170,000 USD per year\\\\n- Infrastructure cost for tests, benchmarks and development: $50,000 USD per year\\\\n\\\\nThis budget covers the compensation for the two primary developers working on the read-rpc project for one year. The funds will be used to ensure continued development, maintenance, and improvement of the read-rpc solution.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "treasury.fastnear.tg", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "220000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Indexers", "RPC Nodes"]}

{"data": {"infrastructure-committee.near": {"index": {"notify": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"mob.near\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"proposal/edit\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"proposal\\\\\\\":13,\\\\\\\"widgetAccountId\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"infrastructure-committee.near\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"notifier\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"trechriron71.near\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

{"id": 16, "body": {"name": "Aeon: permissionless multi-sig for NEAR", "summary": "At Aeon, we\\\\\\'re building the first multi-chain multi-sig for custody of any asset on any chain. We use decentralized MPC, enable permissionless onboarding of chains and DeFi services, and offer sophisticated transaction policies down to the payload level. Our vision: become the hub for multi-chain DeFi and provide an AI agent marketplace for outsourcing work like reporting, trading strategies, and risk management.", "category": "Infrastructure Committee", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "linked_rfp": null, "supervisor": "trechriron71.near", "description": "### Primary person\\\\u{2019}s contact information\\\\nJustin Heinz(justin@aeon.so)\\\\n\\\\n### Size of the whole team\\\\n4\\\\n\\\\n### Size of the engineering team\\\\n3 (+2 starting in Q4)\\\\n\\\\n### Team location\\\\nLisbon, Portugal\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Team background and bios\\\\n\\\\n* Justin - Co-Founder (https://www.linkedin.com/in/justin-alexander-heinz/, https://github.com/fl0ydj): studied at Cambridge, worked at Amazon, built wallet for Outlet finance; prev. founder experience\\\\n* Alex - Co-Founder (https://www.linkedin.com/in/alexander-ludwig-profile/, https://github.com/alexanderludwig): start-up experience in data science; VC for EQT ventures\\\\n* Parshant - Founding Engineer (https://www.linkedin.com/in/psm21/, https://github.com/singhparshant): IIIT Allahabad/ TUM, Goldman Sachs; MPC research at UCL\\\\n* 2 engineers starting in Q4\\\\n* freelance designer\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Product / Value Proposition\\\\n\\\\nBuilding a trustless and permissionless multi-sig for the Near ecosystem, to make it easier for sophisticated investors to hold tokens and interact with Near\\\\u{2019}s DeFi protocols.\\\\nProduct demo: https://www.loom.com/share/270c39a0d9044d59b555dfa04a24e501\\\\n* Allowing trustless custody of any asset on any chain by leveraging Pera\\\\\\'s (formerly dWallet network) decentralized & non-collusive MPC. (Find more details here: https://github.com/dwallet-labs/dwallet-network, https://eprint.iacr.org/2024/253.pdf)\\\\n* Permissionless onboarding of new chains, so ecosystems can onboard themselves in a self-service manner. Existing ecosystem integrations include Bitcoin, EVM, Cosmos, Sui, and Fuel.\\\\nOffers sophisticated transaction policies down to the payload level (e.g., allowing limits on swapping, lending, and borrowing amounts) and other features like user management, address book, and trustless recovery (with a Ledger).\\\\n* Access dApps through our dApp store ecosystem in a secure manner, safeguarded by our policy engine.\\\\nInstitutional-grade security, with part of the key secured by Pera\\\\\\'s decentralized MPC network and the other part by our mobile signing app using the mobile phone\\\\\\'s secure enclave.\\\\n* Integration of chain abstraction and chain-abstracted DeFi services into our product.\\\\n* Product vision: Become a platform for AI agents that users can hire to execute tasks for them, such as executing sophisticated trading strategies (e.g., going long on revenue-generating DeFi projects, shorting infrastructure projects), and advising users on proper risk management techniques. Here we see synergies with NEAR\\\\\\'s strategy and hence would want to integrate such projects and work closely together with them.\\\\n\\\\n### Benefits for the NEAR ecosystem\\\\n* Integration of NEAR into a multi-chain custody solution with policy engine support (NEAR token holders can restrict sender, receiver, and amount of assets being transferred). This increases accessibility of NEAR assets for institutional and sophisticated investors (market makers, liquid/venture funds, sophisticated teams/individuals) to hold assets. The product will be gradually made open-source over the next years.\\\\n* Integration of NEAR multi-chain DeFi projects to be used directly by sophisticated investors from within our product (e.g., swapping and lending).\\\\n* Integration of NEAR AI agents into our platform to offer our customers services provided by these agents.\\\\n\\\\n### Goals / Milestones\\\\n\\\\n**NEAR integration (Target: Q4 2024)**\\\\n* Mainnet launch in Q4 2024, dependent on Pera network\\\\n* Integration of the NEAR RPC API into our chain integration SDK to communicate with and read transactions from the NEAR blockchain\\\\n* Completion of security audits for our core smart contracts and the NEAR transaction assembling module (written in Move)\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n**dApp integration (Q1 2025)**\\\\n* Integration of NEAR ecosystems into our integrated dApp store (as described here: https://x.com/ilblackdragon/status/1821933128799211618)\\\\n* Incorporation of the NEAR wallet selector into our multi-chain extension framework\\\\n \\\\n### Metrics\\\\n**Milestone 1: NEAR integration**\\\\n* Users can hold assets on NEAR and execute transfers of the NEAR native asset, NEP-141 fungible token standard, and NEP-171 non-fungible token standard.\\\\n\\\\n**Milestone 2: dApp integration**\\\\n* Users can natively use the top 10 NEAR dApps through our dApp interface.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Competitor Comparison\\\\n\\\\n#### Alternatives:\\\\n* On-chain multi-sigs (e.g., Gnosis Safe, Squads): Suffer from fragmentation across chains and lack support for non-smart contract chains. However, for NEAR, there is no native multi-sig available offering the same features as Aeon does.\\\\n* MPC-based institutional custody players (e.g., Fireblocks): Slow to innovate, permissioned, closed source, not built from the ground up for DeFi interactions, and expensive.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n#### Our Advantages:\\\\n* Built for DeFi & AI agents: Manage all your positions within our platform.\\\\n* Ability to hire AI agents constrained by the policy engine built for DeFi.\\\\n* Institutional-grade security: Truly decentralized and censorship-resistant. Transactions are cosigned by the user\\\\\\'s mobile phone enclave and a decentralized network.\\\\n\\\\n### Usage & Examples\\\\n\\\\nCurrent testnet launch with 10 investors testing our product. Integration with BTC, EVM, Cosmos, Sui, Fuel. See product demo above.\\\\n\\\\n## Budget\\\\n\\\\n### Budget Total\\\\n\\\\n$62k\\\\n\\\\n### Budget Breakdown\\\\n#### Milestone 1: Near integration $41k\\\\n* Engineering costs smart contract signing module in Move: $14k\\\\n* Smart contract audits: $8k\\\\n* Integration into Aeon chain SDK abstracting Near RPC: $11k\\\\n* Setting up and maintaining subquery indexer: $8k\\\\n \\\\n#### Milestone 2: dApp integration $21k \\\\n* Javascript extension injection flow enabling dApps to connect with Aeon using the Near wallet selector $12k\\\\n* Extend Aeon chain SDK to support Near dApp request processing $9k\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "0xalxx.near", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "62000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Other"]}

{"id": 10, "body": {"name": "Project Zero - Support for NEAR on the current and upcoming products", "summary": "Project Zero and NEAR Infrastructure committee shares the same goal of strengthening NEAR\\\\\\'s key infrastructure for the developers. Project Zero is solving A-Z problems with Blockchain Data Infrastructure ranging from core problem of data extraction to transformation, knowledge discovery with analytics focus and indexing. We believe that dApps and developers should focus on what matters i.e. building their core functionalities instead of spending time & money in dealing with blockchain data infra", "category": "Infrastructure Committee", "timeline": {"status": "REJECTED", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "linked_rfp": null, "supervisor": "trechriron71.near", "description": "# Project Zero\\\\n\\\\n**Primary person\\\\u{2019}s contact information:**\\\\nSiddhartha Jain\\\\nHead of Product\\\\nsiddhartha@projectzero.io\\\\nTelegram: https://t.me/absolutelysid02 \\\\n\\\\n**Size of the whole team:** 12\\\\n\\\\n**Size of the engineering team:** 9\\\\n\\\\n**Team location:** Switzerland, Germany, Ukraine, Latvia, Austria\\\\n\\\\n**Team background and bios**\\\\n[Rachid Ajaja](https://www.linkedin.com/in/rachid-ajaja/) (Strategic Adviser): Web3 OG, serial entrepreneur and Founder of Nexera ecosystem and several other web3 companies and products ranging from DeFi, on-chain risk intelligence and Crypto AML compliance solutions.\\\\n[Siddhartha Jain](https://www.linkedin.com/in/sidjain02/) (Head of Product): Ex- Head of Product at Lava Network and Glassnode. Overall 13+ years big tech & startup experience, previous product leader in a B2B AI based market insights platform and many other tech companies.\\\\nMark Boychuk (CTO): 13 year tech experience along with 5 years of web3 engg. experience ranging from DeFi, on-chain analytics, DEX, EVM smart contracts and other web2 experiences.\\\\nRest of the team: 7 experienced developers with work experience ranging from 5-12 years including significant web3 experiences (DeFi, DEX, Analytics, Infrastructure), 1 QA, 1 designers and a DevRel\\\\n\\\\n**Any affiliations with other NEAR ecosystem partners?:** No\\\\n\\\\n**Professional Experience**:\\\\nProject Zero began its research in 2022 to address critical issues with blockchain data extraction. Since 2022, its use-case-focused on Data extraction with data pipelines or streaming, Data Lake, Query Engine, and Indexer products have been utilized by dApps such as Nexera Exchange, Nexera ID, Nuant, evergonlabs, Wallet infrastructure Brillion and many others.\\\\n\\\\nOur goal is to streamline the blockchain data extraction process, enabling organizations to focus on problem-solving rather than the complexities of developing, managing, and maintaining services in-house or dealing with multiple vendors.\\\\n\\\\nOur mission is to empower DApps, Web3 companies, protocols, and institutions by relieving them from the burdens of infrastructure and blockchain data management. We envision a future where businesses can seamlessly focus on solving their core problems without the complexities of maintaining blockchain data operation infrastructure. We aspire to be the cornerstone solution, akin to what AWS is to cloud computing, enabling innovation and growth in the decentralized ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\nWe are solving all the blockchain data infra. problems with these products:\\\\n- Data Streaming (pipeline)\\\\n- Data transformation (edge computing as a service)\\\\n- Super indexer (multi chain, indexer on top of indexer, high availability & real-time)\\\\n- Query engine with sub-second execution to complex analytics query\\\\n- Set of Enriched APIs\\\\n- Framework for building Custom APIs\\\\n- Marketplace for several off chain & on-chain data (like price feeds)\\\\n\\\\n**Examples of relevant experience with NEAR blockchain:**\\\\nNo experience with supporting the NEAR community \\\\u{201c}yet\\\\u{201d}. We have been working with many EVM L2 blockchains closely and this proposal is to bring our solutions on NEAR blockchain where the developer community can leverage our unique solutions for the various outstanding blockchain data infrastructure problems.\\\\n\\\\n**Non-technical capabilities:**\\\\nWon web3 product of the week on Product Hunt as soon as we launched public Beta.\\\\nProven product-market-fit for several dApp use-cases as the early adopters ranges from DEX, Tokenization platform, On-chain risk intelligence, L1 for data  infra. For AI and LLMs, Wallet, DeFi trading strategy simulator.\\\\nPartnerships and listing with many blockchains along with ongoing advanced discussions. Some of them are Arbitrum, Scroll, Polygon, BitLayer, Manta Network, BVM network, Ziliqa.\\\\nSecured Grants successfully from Nexera governance/DAO for serving their entire infrastructure.\\\\nScheduled multiple marketing campaigns with leading blockchain networks like Arbitrum, Scroll, Manta, Bitlayer etc.\\\\n\\\\n**In-House Resources:**\\\\nOur entire team is in-house on full-time roles. The professional work experience is in the tech industry with multiple years in web3. Total work experience ranges from 5-13 years. \\\\nDesign, UX/UI?: Yes \\\\nProject management?: Yes \\\\nCustomer support?: Yes\\\\nBD / Marketing?: Yes, currently by the Head of Product. Plans to hire a Product Marketer\\\\n\\\\n**Portfolio of relevant work:**\\\\nStream provides seamless access to blockchain raw data both real-time and historical blockchain data. An innovative solution by pushing data to users upon availability. This approach ensures faster, more reliable, and consistent data transmission, fostering trust in the accuracy and timeliness of the data you deliver. Unlike traditional data providers like RPCs or your own node and custom solutions.It efficiently retrieves and delivers transactional data to your preferred destination like S3, Webhook, Kafka etc., ensuring uninterrupted streaming, even during chain reorganizations while maintaining data consistency and with 100% delivery guarantees.\\\\nBlock Functions enable to transform streamed data, boosting efficiency and reducing data size by retrieving exactly the data you need, when you need it. It\\\\u{2019}s edge computing as a service! Just write a JavaScript transformation function & start receiving a stream of high throughput of enriched transformed data instead of raw data. \\\\nQuery Engine (POC & V1.0) provides sub-second results to the most complex data operations and queries across a contract/address and cross-chain. It is targeted to perform analytical queries with performance of regular oltp databases.\\\\nSuper Indexers (Research & POC) stream data of the indexed protocol and beyond. Instead of depending on slow, unreliable subgraphs with a GraphQL interface making it useless when it comes to use at scale. Super Indexers is the solution to all the problems which subgraphs bring along with them.\\\\n\\\\n**Proposal:**\\\\nThis proposal aims to add support to NEAR blockchains and bring the leading innovative solution by being a bespoke blockchain data infrastructure platform to the NEAR ecosystem. Project Zero has a Data extraction and transformation (Block functions), streaming product that eliminates the burden of handling and managing chain reorgs, data inconsistency, unreliable RPCs which are impractical to use at scale, and extremely costly. Project Zero is stepping into the next phases to solve a-z blockchain data-related problems which includes products like Rich API endpoints, Query Engine and Super Indexers.\\\\n\\\\nIn the current scenario, even with the fractional existing solutions, none of them are supporting NEAR blockchain besides The Graph. The following are the benefits for the NEAR ecosystem\\\\nHuge incentive for the builders to launch on NEAR with a significantly reduce time to market dApp due to a free plug-and-play data infrastructure\\\\nNone of the so-called incumbent solutions support NEAR (Alchemy, quicknode, goldsky etc.) \\\\n\\\\nGiven the problems we are solving are very fundamental and relevant wherever on-chain data is required, NEAR developer ecosystem (dApps) can reap all the benefits by saving up to 2x time-to-market and saving their previous limited funding by eliminating the need to maintain huge infrastructure and specialized backend developers. As part of the proposal, we would like to provide 100GB/month of free usage of Streaming + Block Functions at no cost of NEAR blockchain data for 12 months from the date of approval of the proposal. Project Zero is a closed source solution with its proprietary technology and algorithms.\\\\n\\\\n**Goals / Milestones:**\\\\nAdding Near blockchains dataset from genesis: Q3 2024  \\\\nMaintaining the real-time as well as historical data: Always ongoing\\\\nImplement and provide free usage (100GB/month) of Project Zero data streaming of NEAR blockchain (Launch as soon as Task 1 is finished)\\\\nLaunch new features and products on Near: \\\\nFirst set of Rich APIs (Ex: Token API, Transaction history API etc.): End of Q3 or Start Q4 2024\\\\nMore sets of Rich APIs (always ongoing): Q4 2024 and beyond for more\\\\nData Lake and Query Engine on NEAR Blockchain: Q4\\\\\\'24\\\\nSuper Indexers v1.0 on NEAR: End of Q4\\\\\\'24 or Beginning Q1\\\\u{2019}25\\\\nSupport other types of off chain and chain data like Price feeds etc.: Q1\\\\u{2019}25\\\\n\\\\nThe timelines are subjected to the proposal approval date. We are assuming the proposal gets approved well before the end of Q3\\\\u{2019}24. For the other new products (4-6), we will try to provide some Freemium usage for the NEAR community.\\\\n\\\\n**Metrics:**\\\\nThe key success criteria or metrics are:\\\\nAdoption of Project Zero by NEAR dApps\\\\nUser retention\\\\nHigh NPS/CSAT score\\\\n\\\\n**Competitor Comparison:**\\\\nWe don\\\\u{2019}t find any 1:1 competitor who is solving all the blockchain data infrastructure problems but we view competitors at specific products level.\\\\nStreaming & Transformation - Quicknode: Project Zero has an edge with the additional type of chain reorg handling strategy, performance of chain reorg handling, higher throughput and optimized block functions. On a fast blockchain like Arbitrum, Project Zero handles more than 4 blocks per second where the existing solution isn\\\\\\'t even close to it!\\\\nSuper Indexer - The Graph (only major indexer supporting NEAR): Subgraphs on The Graph network lack usability at scale and are highly rate limited with GraphQL endpoints. Moreover the availability and freshness of real-time data isn\\\\u{2019}t common as the entire model is based on the network of operators which prefers maintaining high incentive subgraphs and blockchains. Project Zero will eliminate all these problems by providing a highly available stream of indexed data at a rapid throughput, negligible delay in real-time data update and 100% delivery guarantees.\\\\nQuery Engine and Rich APIs: There are no major platforms supporting NEAR but Project Zero differentiates with its modular architecture where adding new tables, blockchains, custom data and scaling new APIs is significantly low effort with high performance. Most of our filters by contract/address on optimized tables give subsecond performance.\\\\n\\\\n**Usage & Examples:**\\\\nProject Zero is the bespoke data infrastructure for Nexera Exchange, leveraging both historical backfills and real-time data of Ethereum and Arbitrum to their destination tools and platforms for several features. The most popular features are the [price chart](https://app.nexera.exchange/trade/ethereum/0xc02aaa39b223fe8d0a0e5c4f27ead9083c756cc2/0xdac17f958d2ee523a2206206994597c13d831ec7/100) and [order book](https://app.nexera.exchange/trade/ethereum/0xc02aaa39b223fe8d0a0e5c4f27ead9083c756cc2/0xdac17f958d2ee523a2206206994597c13d831ec7/100). Nexera built entire backend modules based on Project Zero data and created several services for volume, price, order status, etc.\\\\n\\\\nNexera Exchange faced several complications in extracting blockchain data at scale for something as simple as price charts on different time frames. They were dependent on several RPCs on very expensive pricing plans, which were also limited due to trace and debug calls. With Project Zero, they can stream historical data in minutes, resulting in immense performance gains, better user experience, and reduced costs. They mainly use \\\\u{2018}blocks with receipts\\\\u{2019} and \\\\u{2018}Logs\\\\u{2019} from different block numbers across multiple streams. \\\\n\\\\nBecause of Project Zero, Nexera Exchange benefits from faster chain reorg handling (4 blocks per second) on Arbitrum, which existing solutions can\\\\u{2019}t offer. We reduced recurring infrastructure costs of 15k/month to one-third of it.\\\\n\\\\nProject Zero is already empowering and soon empowering (in a few weeks from now) following blockchains Arbitrum, Bitlayer, Scroll, Manta, Polygon, Base, Optimism, Solana and Binance chain.\\\\n\\\\n**Budget Total:**\\\\n$240,000/year\\\\n\\\\n**Budget Breakdown:**\\\\nThe budget will mainly be used for scaling and maintaining infrastructure and operation costs of the products\\\\nAdding NEAR blockchain dataset from genesis\\\\nMaintaining the real-time as well as historical data\\\\nOffer free streams of 100GB/month on NEAR\\\\nBlock Functions (edge computing) for data transformation & filtering\\\\nLaunch new features and products like Rich APIs, Query Engine and Super Indexers on NEAR from initial public versions.\\\\n\\\\nWe are flexible in the recurring payment period of yearly, quarterly or monthly but with grants support for at least a year.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "projectzero.near", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "240000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Other", "Indexers", "Query API", "Data Lakes"]}

{"id": 5, "body": {"name": "Footprint: Powerful Data APIs and GPT Tools for Near Developers to Easily Build", "summary": "Problem: The Near blockchain\\\\\\'s data infrastructure is underdeveloped, making it difficult for developers to access and process on-chain data. The non-EVM nature of Near adds complexity to data parsing and processing. Solution: Provide standardized, structured APIs for on-chain data on Near, enabling developers to efficiently access data. Offer an AI-powered assistant for developers to gain the necessary knowledge for building on Near.", "category": "Infrastructure Committee", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": "trechriron71.near", "description": "## Footprint Analytics\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Primary person\\\\u{2019}s contact information\\\\nTelegram handle: @dplinnn\\\\n\\\\n### Size of the whole team\\\\nFootprint has a team of 20+ full-time developers - 10 AI and Big Data, 4 Backend, 3 Frontend, 2 Analysts, and 2 + Ops.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Team background and bios\\\\nOur core team is made up of experienced developers.\\\\n\\\\nPrior to venturing into the blockchain space, our team members have worked in reputed companies such as Goldman Sachs, JP Morgan Chase and Oracle.\\\\n\\\\nOur three co-founders have been working together for 11 years, showcasing a long-term commitment to shared goals and synergy.\\\\n\\\\nKey Team Profiles:\\\\n1. Tony Zhang - Co-founder & CEO \\\\n- A serial entrepreneur with over 20 years of experience on Wall Street \\\\n- Formerly Senior Vice President of Global Credit Trading at Bank of America in New York; Director of Credit - - Derivatives Trading at Merrill Lynch, also worked at Goldman Sachs Global, JPMorgan, and Lehman Brothers\\\\n2. Wade Deng - Co-founder & CTO \\\\n- Over a decade of tech experience\\\\n- Director of a fintech company where he built anti-fraud systems and AI models for credit score\\\\n- Led a crypto trading team, which focused on algo trading strategy on CeFi\\\\n3. Navy Tse - Co-founder & Head of Product\\\\n- Over 10 years of experience in fintech, big data, e-commerce, and mobile internet development\\\\n- Entered the blockchain technology space in 2017\\\\n- Led the team to develop several DeFi projects\\\\n- A pioneer in the open source community, contributed to the Open Source Project with over 37k stars.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Professional Experience\\\\n\\\\n**Blockchain Data Capabilities**\\\\n\\\\nFootprint Analytics has been online for over three years and has extensive expertise in the blockchain and big data space. We are capable of handling both EVM and non-EVM chains. We have successfully indexed 30+chains,including Solana and some EVM chains\\\\u{2019} trace data, demonstrating our ability to manage large volumes of data effectively. Given Near\\\\\\'s substantial historical on-chain data and the high volume of daily transactions, we are confident in our ability to handle it proficiently.\\\\n\\\\nMoreover, we are dedicated to making data more accessible and lowering the barriers to entry. We excel at abstracting and summarizing data to transform it into business-meaningful insights. Our data and APIs are designed for ease of use, covering areas such as GameFi data, token data, wallet data, and more.\\\\n\\\\n**Technical Architecture Details:**\\\\n1. Program language: Python, Javascript\\\\n2. Technical design: https://www.processon.com/view/link/632d7bd8637689341d71c50d \\\\n- Query engine: Doris, Trino\\\\n- Storage: Iceberg\\\\n- Compute engine: Trino\\\\n- Real-time: Flink + Kafka\\\\n3. Data architecture, https://files.readme.io/2ab5caf-Screenshot_2022-10-27_at_08.35.37.png \\\\n- Bronze\\\\n- Silver\\\\n- Gold\\\\n\\\\n**Non-Technical Capabilities and Resources:**\\\\n1. Research Capabilities and Resources: Research portal available for the entire community, offering metrics that matter for the ecosystem and projects all in one place. Our in-house research team collaborates with media and the community to produce market reports. We can amplify Near\\\\u{2019}s progress with dashboards and research reports. We have over 50+ media channels with 500k+ exposure.\\\\n2. Marketing Resources: Footprint has over 50k Twitter followers. To maximize exposure opportunities, projects can get featured on Footprint\\\\\\'s Twitter, participate in our Twitter Spaces, and engage in other community activities.\\\\n3. Community Support: Footprint provides dedicated analyst support to help users or projects build data dashboards and offer data tutorials.\\\\n4. AI-Powered Growth Tool: A growth tool based on the telegram and discord communities. Unlike other quests, we can provide verification of on-chain and off-chain interactions, introduce viral functions, and help projects achieve growth in key on-chain indicators.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Body\\\\n\\\\nFootprint\\\\\\'s proposal focuses on providing ready-to-use data APIs and AI-powered assistants to enable more developers to easily onboard their applications onto Near. Additionally, by increasing Near\\\\\\'s brand exposure and influence through research content, we aim to attract more developers to the Near ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\nAs a non-EVM chain, Near has a complex data structure and vast on-chain data, making it costly for ordinary projects to parse and manage this data. Footprint\\\\\\'s solution addresses this issue. We believe that stable and user-friendly APIs will significantly accelerate development and improve developer efficiency. Pre-configured research pages will allow investors, researchers, and KOLs to easily access and use data.\\\\n\\\\nBeyond data, we aim to bring a data-driven culture and transformation to Near. We will provide the community with free growth tools based on Telegram and Discord, combining on-chain and off-chain interactive community growth tools to assist in acquiring traffic. Provide data support for marketing efforts\\\\u{ff0c}such as TVL/DAU project/user rankings, Use viral tools to incentivize users to improve their leaderboard standings.\\\\n\\\\n## Goals / Milestones\\\\n\\\\nOur implementation program consists of two main parts: data API infrastructure and AI GPT creation.\\\\n**Data APIs:**\\\\nTo support developer growth, we offer a comprehensive API suite covering chain raw data, tokens, wallets, and key project indicators. Developers can access data with a single line of code, enabling rapid on-chain app development with a user-friendly experience.\\\\n**AI Assistant:**\\\\nDevelopers face numerous challenges before building on-chain, making mentorship crucial. Our Developer AI Assistant, customized for NEAR, incorporates NEAR\\\\\\'s development documentation, community guidelines, and fundamental blockchain knowledge. This trained GPT helps developers quickly access information through natural language queries, including our API interfaces and documentation. This allows developers to minimize learning time, write more efficient code, and focus on building core product functionality.\\\\n\\\\n**Milestone 1 Near chain data API**\\\\nTasks: By providing the raw data API and generating structured data tables, developers can use the data API to build any application or build a data analytics system for their project.And users can use the data on Footprint to create charts and dashboards and explore the data freely.\\\\nDeliverables:\\\\nNear chain data APIs: transactions, receipts, logs and blocks\\\\nNear chain data analytics dashboard\\\\nBatch download solution for get the all historical\\\\n  \\\\n**Milestone 2: Key indicators data API for dapps on Near **\\\\nTasks: We will collect and verify the contracts belonging to the projects on the chain, and produce reference data of the contracts of the projects on the chain, so that developers can easily find all the records of the contracts corresponding to each project. Secondly, based on the contract, we will also build key indicators data and API of the protocol, which can be used to discover the popular projects on the chain and view the performance of the projects, including DAU, TVL, transaction, volume, new user growth, etc.\\\\nDeliverables:\\\\nReference data of contracts and protocols\\\\nKey indicators of Dapp: DAU, transactions, TVL and more\\\\nKey indicators data APIs\\\\nDapp ranking dashboard\\\\n  \\\\n**Milestone 3 Token price data of tokens on Near**\\\\nTasks: Real-time 5-minute coin price data will provide the most solid and widespread support for on-chain data analytics, allowing for easy calculation of volume, balance, TVL and other metrics in USD.\\\\nDeliverables:\\\\nStructured data table: token_5min_price\\\\nToken price data API\\\\n  \\\\n**Milestone 4: Developer AI assistant for Near ecosystem**\\\\nTasks: We can customize an AI gpt assistant for Near developers, and we can add project docs, whitepapers, on-chain data, etc. to the GPT to enable it to answer development questions and provide 24/7 community service.\\\\nDeliverables:\\\\nA developer GPT assistan\\\\n   \\\\n\\\\n \\\\n## Metrics\\\\nWe will measure success based on the following deliverables and metrics:\\\\n1. The APIs will all deliveried and can be called in docs.\\\\n2. We will deliver Near\\\\\\'s data and promote Near\\\\\\'s dashboard through various channels such as articles and community engagements, aiming to achieve over 100,000 views for the Near data dashboard.\\\\n3. We will collect and maintain data on Near\\\\\\'s blockchain, ensuring that the protocols included represent over 80% of the total value locked (TVL).\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Budget\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Budget Breakdown\\\\n\\\\nHuman resources involvement (60% of the funds)\\\\n1.1 Technical resources for data analysis and function development\\\\n1.2 Data maintenance\\\\n1.3 Community and technical support\\\\n\\\\nNode and server costs (40% of the funds)\\\\n2.1 Purchase of node services\\\\n2.2 Data storage\\\\n2.3 Computing resources according to different data tables and metrics\\\\n\\\\nWe are eager to collaborate more closely with the NEAR ecosystem and contribute positively. Looking forward to hearing feedback from the community on the proposal.\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "524f24bb0320fa84ab2ea93e589019c2c4c60a3a6a45dd0577bd6e97f40f1521", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "80000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Indexers", "Query API"]}

{"id": 15, "body": {"name": "Data Marketplace NEAR by The Indexing Company", "summary": "The Indexing Company is introducing a new data solution called the Data Marketplace to empower developers with reliable and affordable data pipelines for the NEAR ecosystem. The Data Marketplace offers reliable indexing, highly configurable data pipelines and connections to the required data infrastructure. \\\\n\\\\nBenefits include: faster data access, reduced costs, scalability and faster development times.", "category": "Infrastructure Committee", "timeline": {"status": "REJECTED", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "linked_rfp": null, "supervisor": "trechriron71.near", "description": "## Organization\\\\n\\\\n### Primary person\\\\u{2019}s contact information\\\\nStephen King \\\\nEmail: stephen@indexing.co\\\\nTelegram: https://t.me/stephenkinger \\\\nCompany website: www.indexing.co  \\\\n\\\\n### Size of the whole team\\\\n7 team members 1 COO, 1 CTO, 1 CMO, 1 Biz Dev / Analyst, 3 developers\\\\n\\\\n### Size of the engineering team\\\\n1 CTO, 3 developers, 1 on-chain analyst\\\\n\\\\n### Team location\\\\nWorldwide, but most members are located in the US. \\\\n\\\\n### Team background and bios\\\\nBrock Haugen, CEO\\\\nBrock is a long-time engineer with a degree in Mathematics, now co-founder. He\\\\u{2019}s spent the last 7 years leading engineering efforts for products and infrastructure in the web3 space for companies such as Coinbase and Dappcentral.\\\\n\\\\nStephen King, COO\\\\nStephen is a second-time web3 founder, with a background in product, sales & operations. Stephen has also been an active angel investor in projects such Polkadot, OpenZeppelin & Messari. \\\\n\\\\nBobby Miller, Principal Engineer\\\\nBobby is a software engineering leader who has led product engineering teams at a variety of consumer facing startups including Moat, Daily Harvest, and most recently Kava Labs. He has been an avid participant of the crypto space since 2015. He is also the Hot Dog Honcho.\\\\n\\\\nDennis Verstappen, Data analyst\\\\nDennis is a data analyst with a passion for making data actionable. Been in crypto since 2017 where he gained experience with trading, DeFi, venture capital. Dennis worked with various projects on product development, analytics, tokenomics and marketing.\\\\n\\\\n### Any affiliations with other NEAR ecosystem partners?\\\\nBlockPi - we saw BlockPi in the Infra Comm request group too. We use BlockPi as our Main RPC provider for our indexing since they provide reliable node infrastructure and RPC endpoints. \\\\n\\\\nIn addition to these affiliations our team members spoke to NEAR team members and projects in the ecosystem in the past. We learned  that the data infrastructure on NEAR was underserved. These initial contacts let us dive deeper into the NEAR blockchain ecosystem which is why we like to get involved.\\\\n\\\\n## Professional Experience\\\\n\\\\n### Examples of relevant experience with NEAR blockchain\\\\nA previous co-founder, Russell McLernon, was very active in NEAR around 2018-2019. More recently, we\\\\u{2019}ve garnered interest from projects building in the AI space and we believe NEAR could be a great platform for those applications. \\\\n\\\\n### Non-technical capabilities\\\\nSince our proposal is an infrastructure proposal most of the capabilities needed will be developer work and on-chain analysis. \\\\n\\\\nNon-technical capabilities crucial to this proposal include market research and business development. These skills will help us understand the data needs of projects within the NEAR ecosystem. Our business development team will reach out to ecosystem projects during the development phase to gather feedback and insights. Any introductions by the NEAR foundation are welcome. Upon completion, we will actively seek out projects interested in integrating our solution to enhance their products with reliable and efficient data processing.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### In-House Resources\\\\nDesign, UX/UI: If there is a GUI component, our developer team can design the UX/UI themselves.\\\\nProject management: since this is a technical project, the CTO will take care of the project management.\\\\nCustomer support: for the product, we will have developer support through documentation and contacts ready for support via chat or calls from our developer team or BD team. \\\\nBD / Marketing: our BD team will actively engage with projects in the NEAR ecosystem to implement our technology and find users. Warm introductions from the NEAR Foundation will help lay these contacts. Our CMO and BD team will work on content related to the Data Marketplace. \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Portfolio of relevant work\\\\nCase Study, Once Upon: Block Explorer that we are currently serving +27 chains.\\\\nhttps://www.indexing.co/once-upon \\\\n\\\\nCase Study, Wovn: NFT Marketplace where we replaced two backend engineers ($150,000/year) to process & supply data from multiple ecosystems. \\\\nhttps://www.indexing.co/wovn \\\\n\\\\nMesh Testimonial: https://www.linkedin.com/posts/meshconnectapi_embeddedfinance-fintech-web3-activity-7181666883652186113-bJHg\\\\n\\\\n## Body\\\\n\\\\n#### The primary approach and solution of the proposal\\\\nIn Web3 most data solutions are stuck in web2 approaches. Data is often provided through APIs, which provide fiction and additional costs for projects. Other indexing tools require custom coding and hosting. Specific data models are frequently introduced, which allows for too many intermediate steps that add friction and costs. The current data providers come with their own opinions on how data should be processed, stored, and sold. All of this leads to web3 businesses being forced to further build data infrastructure in-house to get the end data their products actually need. When solving this problem, we can try to eliminate the API layers on top of centralized solutions, make the data infrastructure reliable, and ensure developers have enough control over retrieving the data. \\\\n\\\\nWe started The Indexing Company to directly address the actual problems web3 businesses face in accessing data. They need affordable, reliable data infrastructure that they control. That infrastructure is fully configurable by and therefore controlled by, end businesses. All of which translates to the elimination of much of the \\\\u{201c}standard\\\\u{201d} web3 data architecture. With us, a business gets exactly the data they need in their databases or in their dApps from the beginning. We aim to have no centralized database or data to sell directly.\\\\n\\\\nOne of the challenges in the expansion of the NEAR ecosystem is to service the developers with good data tooling so they can work towards Chain Abstraction and the fast throughput of NEAR. NEAR\\\\\\'s high throughput, with daily transaction amounts varying between 2 million to 6 million last year, generates a vast amount of data that requires efficient processing. Developers need a way to find exactly the data they require without having to process excess information. The challenge lies in:\\\\n- Maintaining the indexers and data infrastructure needed to get data from these chains.\\\\n- Having data pipelines that can handle the high throughput of NEAR. \\\\n- Getting data from other chains and data related to AVS like Validator data. \\\\n- Acquiring talented developers to manage this infrastructure, do the indexing and perform the data engineering.\\\\n\\\\nWe are planning to develop a solution called the Data Marketplace. Developers of dApps can come to the console of the marketplace to configure the data pipelines they want by selecting the data, do custom transformations and stream the data directly to their own data infrastructure. \\\\n\\\\nDevelopers need a way to find exactly the data they require without having to process excess information. We believe the Data Marketplace is an excellent solution to this problem, as it streamlines data access and reduces the burden on developers, allowing them to focus on building innovative applications. In the long run we want to open up the Data Marketplace for other suppliers, for now we want to focus on solving the demand and making the data pipeline configuration as easy as possible.\\\\n\\\\n#### The Data Marketplace\\\\n\\\\nThe Data Marketplace can be interacted with by developers through an easy to use interface. Since we believe the future is multi-chain and modular, the Data Marketplace will be fitting for the NEAR ecosystem and data needs of the builders. This means that the data offered in the interface can come from NEAR, while we also can offer other types of data like Farcaster data or other chains. For the Farcaster data we have an example workflow live: https://console.indexing.co/marketplace/66b3798bcc24e0cc3333b2d9\\\\nWe aim to support whole ecosystems like NEAR and can provide support with guidance from the ecosystem. The perspective from the NEAR ecosystem can help with defining presets and templates, while being opinionated on which data is most important for the builders.\\\\n\\\\nThe interface will give developers an easy way to configure which data they want:\\\\n1. Data selection: Developers can select the chain(s) they want data from. Since they might need specific data they could select wide data criteria like all ERC20/token transfers, logs, or DEX Swaps. If they only want specific data like contracts or events they will be able to select these specifically. This way of configuration ensures only processing happens for the data they want and reduces the amount of data storage on the developers end.\\\\n2. Backfilling historical data: After selecting the data we can use those parameters to get the historical data and backfill that data. Because of the cache we build up for a chain and optimized infrastructure the backfills can be done really fast.\\\\n3. Real time data streaming: For new data being indexed based on that data selection the pipelines can provide low-latency throughput to the target data infrastructure.\\\\n4. Custom transformations: To ensure the data fits the target data schemas and reduce further processing by the developers, custom transformations can be done in the data pipelines. This enables developers to build a more unified data schema and makes integrating new data and chains easier. \\\\n5. Support and feedback function: Developers might not be familiar with the interface or need help configuring the data pipelines. We aim to have personalized and custom support easily available to get the developers setup as fast as possible. \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n#### Why should the committee choose this project\\\\nWe believe that for Web3 to scale, the barrier to entry to build needs to be easier and more cost-effective. Currently, there is this rite of passage when it comes to getting clean, usable Web3 data: Accumulate third-party API providers, combine them with your own in-house custom logic, and you get a messy pipeline that begins to break down as you scale. Our solution eliminates all of that with fast, affordable, on-demand processing. We\\\\u{2019}re proving this out by saving companies like Once Upon, Bello and Mesh hundreds of thousands per year and months of development time.\\\\n\\\\nThe Data Marketplace will help NEAR developers have an easy way to get the data they need, delivered wherever they need since we not only have the indexing on demand, but the self-service interface will reduce the effort needed to configure the data pipeline.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Goals / Milestones\\\\n1. Onboard NEAR to our Indexing Pipelines and our internal Data Marketplace. Processing the data once, helps us develop the test environment and eventually use this historical data.\\\\n2. Identify 3-5 key NEAR ecosystem data needs such as NFT sales or DeFi swaps and build presets for those. The research of these data needs helps us define our presets, while ensuring NEAR developers can use these presets directly in their applications. \\\\n3. Create a self-serve interface for developers to easily configure the data pipelines. We would like to make the onboarding process as easy as possible and thus a graphical interface could streamline the process.\\\\n4. Create connectors to the target data infrastructure and create templates for data schemas. To ensure good connectivity between our pipelines and the target data infrastructure various most commonly used connectors should be programmed. Data schemas could be provided to help developers easily setup the structure in their own data infrastructure and make the setup process seamless.\\\\n\\\\n \\\\n## Metrics\\\\n#### Indexer and fast backfills\\\\nTo remove the need for developers to setup and maintain the data infrastructure for the indexer and data pipelines. Since NEAR is a high throughput chain, we will optimize the indexer for speed. Focusing on high throughput optimization will enable fast backfilling of historical data. For real time indexing we aim to reduce the time from block confirmation to hit the data infrastructure within max 5 seconds.. We will have the option for developers to delay blocks being processed with a cache, to ensure finality on the chain.\\\\n\\\\n#### Data Marketplace Presets \\\\n3-5 key ecosystem data needs to be exposed as presets on the Data Marketplace. These presets come from the needs of the developers and dApps on NEAR. A few examples of what these presets can be:\\\\n- DeFi swaps and token pricing\\\\n- Token and NFT metadata on-chain\\\\n- Token transfers\\\\n- NFT transfers\\\\n- Wallet holdings \\\\n\\\\n#### Self-Service interface\\\\nThe self-service interface will remove the need from developers to create complex configuration files and learn a new framework. We will have the possibility to do transformations and custom calculations in both the interface and in code. We can\\\\u{2019}t give estimates on the time and frustration reduction on the developers end although we aim to have the following elements in the interface:\\\\n- Previewing the data\\\\n- Custom transformation in both the UI and in a code editor\\\\n- Selection of data output data infrastructure\\\\n- Possibility to backfill the data\\\\n- Support functionality\\\\n\\\\n#### Data infrastructure connectivity\\\\nWe aim to support the most common databases, starting with Postgres while we also would like to support writing to AWS S3. We also would like to support Webhooks. Further output targets and connectors could be determined together with the NEAR builders and ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Usage & Examples\\\\n\\\\nThe Data Marketplace itself is in development while pieces of the technology of the underlying data infrastructure and indexer are already active for more than 15 businesses using our technology. Users include: Mesh, Bello, Disco, Karma3Labs, Crystal, Absinthe Labs. With more new businesses and ecosystems in the pipeline. A solution called Just In Time Indexing received support and a grant from the Starknet ecosystem, which is currently being developed.   \\\\n\\\\nFor the more than 15 customers we have, we process more than 250M transformations per month, with in some months tapping into more than 500M transformations when more backfills are needed. \\\\n\\\\n## Budget\\\\n\\\\n### Budget Total\\\\n$85,000 for onboarding the data, the indexer, the Data Marketplace interface and the connectivity to the output infrastructure. An additional $50,000 could be budgeted for resources for the NEAR developer community.\\\\n\\\\n### Budget Breakdown\\\\n\\\\n#### $10,000 for onboarding NEAR data\\\\nTo onboard the NEAR data we will have costs to process the historical data and keep up with the real time data. We call historical nodes to retrieve the data, decode all data and store them in compressed files. These files will be needed for efficiently backfilling the historical data.\\\\n\\\\n#### $25,000 to build the NEAR Data Marketplace presets\\\\nFor building the Data Marketplace presets we will have to do market research and on-chain analytics to define which subsets of data will be the base for the presets. Presets might be obvious like NFT transfers or DeFi transactions, but we will have to include finding edge cases to make the data reliable. The developers need to build out these presets so they can easily be queried or requested. Finally, the testing and checks of the data is included in this estimation. \\\\n\\\\n#### $25,000 for the self-service user interface\\\\nTo ensure a smooth developer experience we will create a compelling self-service user interface to ensure easy onboarding and less custom development work. In addition we will create documentation and content for developers to easily understand the interface and functionalities. These materials will be used in marketing for the Data Marketplace for further visibility.\\\\n\\\\n#### $25,000 for the output data infrastructure connectivity\\\\nTo tailor to the wishes of the developers we would like to support as much popular target databases and infrastructure as possible. Ensuring the proper connectors are in place will help reduce the setup time and burden on the end-user. We would like to provide configuration files and data schemas for the developers to reduce the setups and data engineering they have to do in their own data infrastructure.\\\\n\\\\n#### (Optionally) $50,000 to support builders with free data processing\\\\nSince we would like to support builders as fast as possible and without any hurdles, the NEAR Infrastructure grant committee could decide to cover costs upfront so builders can use the data marketplace for free during the first period. We can determine the amount of blocks or budget beforehand. Important is that during the processing we would only count the blocks being processed for a data pipeline, which means only blocks that fit the conditions will be counted. For example, if a data pipeline only processed DEX trades, if a block does not contain a DEX trade, this won\\\\u{2019}t be processed and thus won\\\\u{2019}t count for this budget. This removes unnecessary block processing which makes this very optimized for this budget. \\\\n\\\\nWe have a different pricing for real time and backfilling data. The backfills can be more optimized and do not require real time monitoring, hence why these are cheaper. \\\\n- $0.80 / 1000 blocks for real time processing. On a $50,000 budget that would mean 62.5 million blocks can be processed.\\\\n- $0.20 / 1000 blocks for backfilling historical data. On a $50,000 budget that would mean 250 million blocks can be used during the backfilling process. \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "7b060e2e85dbdfbd1ad55e735c4b28da904f7df9f9d409bb0c422923010ac99c", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "85000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Indexers"]}
