{"id": 9, "body": {"name": "Nightly - Regular Quarterly Wallet Support Policy #134", "summary": "Nightly and NEAR share a vision for the future of Web3, with Nightly as the first multi-chain wallet supporting NEAR.\\\\n\\\\nWe\\\\u{2019}re committed to providing users with a comprehensive blockchain experience by integrating additional chains and developing new features like Sidepanel, a mobile app, and hardware wallet support.\\\\n\\\\nOur goal is to enhance crypto wallets as essential tools for dApps and to build a wallet standard and Nightly Connect, improving analytics by analyzing traffic.", "category": "Infrastructure Committee", "timeline": {"status": "APPROVED_CONDITIONALLY", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "linked_rfp": null, "supervisor": "trechriron71.near", "description": "## Organization\\\\nNightly Wallet\\\\n\\\\n### Primary person\\\\u{2019}s contact information\\\\nDominik Gnap https://t.me/Pannggg \\\\nNorbert Bodziony https://t.me/NorbertBodziony\\\\n\\\\n### Size of the whole team\\\\n15 people\\\\n\\\\n### Size of the engineering team\\\\n9 people \\\\n\\\\n### Team location\\\\nCracow, Poland\\\\n\\\\n### Team background and bios\\\\nNorbert Bodziony is a founder and core developer of Nightly. He is a young Polish blockchain developer who graduated with a Master\\\\u{2019}s degree from the University of Science and Technology in Cracow. Before starting his own company, he worked as a trader at Star Beta and as a full-stack engineer at Rumblefish. Norbert has gained coding experience on several blockchains, including Ethereum, Solana, and NEAR. He is one of the early contributors to the Anchor framework. His main focus is decentralized finance; his first major project, Synthetify, led him to win the 2021 Solana x Serum Hackathon. He is also a contributor and advisor to several projects.\\\\n\\\\nAdditionally, we have won several hackathons, such as the CTF MOVEment Hackathon and the Solana x Serum DeFi Hackathon. As a team, we have been awarded multiple grants from the Aleph Zero Foundation, the Vara Foundation, and the NEAR Foundation.\\\\n\\\\n### Any affiliations with other NEAR ecosystem partners?\\\\nWe have been developing a wallet on NEAR since 2022 and received a grant that year. We have many partner projects, including Burrow Finance, Metapool, Everstake, and REF Finance.\\\\n\\\\nWe have established successful partnerships with other projects to provide our users with additional features. For example, we have implemented a swap feature thanks to our partnership with REF Finance and offer liquid staking through our cooperation with Metapool. Additionally, users can stake directly through the wallet and choose from a variety of validators.\\\\n\\\\n## Professional Experience\\\\nOur core team has been working in crypto since 2020, though we have individually contributed to various other projects as well. We launched Nightly in Q2 2022. Initially, it was a wallet supporting only NEAR and Solana, but it now operates on over 10 chains, including Sui and EVMs.\\\\n\\\\nPreviously, our team was involved in two major projects: Synthetify, a decentralized synthetic assets exchange built on Solana, and Invariant, an AMM DEX operating on Solana, Eclipse, and Aleph Zero.\\\\nOur team focuses on bringing new users to crypto by lowering the entry point. We offer a range of solutions, such as the \\\\\\'dApps\\\\\\' tab, which showcases the most important projects on the chain; the ability to buy tokens directly in the wallet; and Nightly Connect, which facilitates the connection between dApps and wallets.\\\\n\\\\nWe have achieved victories in various hackathons, including the CTF MOVEment Hackathon and the Solana x Serum DeFi Hackathon. Our team has also secured several grants from the Aleph Zero Foundation, the Vara Foundation, and the NEAR Foundation.\\\\n\\\\n### Examples of relevant experience with NEAR blockchain\\\\nWe were among the first wallets on NEAR. We were the first to fully support NEAR Wallet migration and the first to implement cross-chain functionality.\\\\n\\\\nOur wallet has pioneered advanced features such as liquid staking within the wallet, in-wallet swaps, and DApps integration. We successfully developed Nightly Connect v1 to simplify the connection between the wallet and dApps, implemented hardware wallet support, and integrated domain management directly within the wallet. Additionally, we have built a fully supported mobile wallet on NEAR.\\\\n\\\\nThese achievements have advanced NEAR\\\\u{2019}s capabilities and solidified our position as innovators in the ecosystem. However, we are continuously seeking new opportunities to develop features such as a Safari extension and the Earn tab.\\\\n\\\\n### Non-technical capabilities:\\\\nWe are a fully independent team with our own Backend, Frontend, Design, and Marketing/BD teams. We are capable of building new features, developing smart contracts, and organizing activities such as AMAs and other community events both online and offline.\\\\n\\\\n### In-House Resources;\\\\nEngineering Team: 9\\\\nDesign, UX/UI: 2\\\\nProject Management: 1\\\\nCustomer Support: 1\\\\nBD/Marketing: 2\\\\nTotal: 15 people\\\\n\\\\n### Portfolio of relevant work\\\\n\\\\nNightly Wallet - a multi-chain wallet designed to harness the full potential of blockchain. It includes both a browser extension and a mobile wallet, supporting Solana, NEAR, Aptos, Sui, Aleph Zero, Vara, Movement, Sonic, Polkadot and EVM.\\\\n\\\\nNightly Connect - a permissionless, open-source tool that functions as both a wallet adapter and a bridge wallet, enabling connections via QR codes or deep links. It simplifies the process for dApp developers by automatically adding all standard-compliant wallets after a one-time implementation. While minimal changes are needed on the wallet\\\\\\'s side for compatibility, these updates allow any mobile wallet to connect to any dApp through Nightly Connect, with additional features like push notifications. It is currently available on Solana, Sui, Aptos, and Movement, with plans to implement it on NEAR as well.\\\\n\\\\nInvariant - a peer-to-peer system on Solana, Eclipse, and Aleph Zero for trading assets. It uses smart contracts to ensure security, self-custody, and resistance to censorship, all without relying on intermediaries who could limit access.\\\\n\\\\n## Body\\\\n\\\\n[//]: # (The primary approach and solution of the proposal.)\\\\nNightly and NEAR share similar approaches to the future of their products. NEAR projects are expanding and exploring cross-blockchain solutions in the Web3 space (https://near.org/blog/nuffle-labs). Nightly aligns with these values as the first multi-chain wallet supporting NEAR, and we continue to integrate additional chains to provide our users with a comprehensive experience, including easily accessible blockchains and their unique features.\\\\n\\\\nMoreover, we believe that successful products must continually evolve to make crypto usage as simple and accessible as possible. To this end, we have been diligently developing new features over the past few months. Notable additions include:\\\\n- Sidepanel: This feature allows our extension wallet to function as a constantly open side panel alongside the active extension.\\\\n- Mobile App: We are updating our mobile wallet to mirror the features of our extension wallet, ensuring it is equally functional and useful.\\\\n- Hardware Wallet Integrations: We are working on supporting various hardware wallets, including Keystone, and are also aiming to integrate Keystone support into our mobile wallet.\\\\n\\\\nOur primary goal is to enhance the functionality and utility of crypto wallets, making them essential tools for interacting with any dApp. At Nightly, we are committed to expanding the capabilities of wallets beyond their traditional roles. We have made significant progress in diversifying our income through various revenue streams, including partnerships with other dApps. These strategic collaborations will enable us to create sustainable and profitable solutions within the wallet ecosystem.\\\\n- Staking: We partner with validators such as Everstake to encourage users to stake through Nightly.\\\\n- Liquid Staking: Our partnership with Metapool allows users to liquid stake and receive stNEAR directly in their wallets without leaving the platform.\\\\n- Swaps: We have partnered with REF Finance and integrated their dApp into our wallet, allowing NEAR users to swap tokens directly within Nightly. We receive a fee from REF Finance for these transactions.\\\\n\\\\nThese features are already implemented in Nightly, but we aim to offer even more possibilities for an enhanced wallet experience, making Nightly the central hub for NEAR while ensuring our \\\\nsustainability.\\\\n\\\\nWe are also developing additional features to help generate yield:\\\\nEarn Tab: This feature within our wallet allows users to deposit and withdraw tokens to on-chain dApps directly from the wallet. It includes options for borrowing, lending, creating pools, and liquid staking. Users will see APYs for each option, providing a comprehensive view in one place. This feature will also increase exposure for dApps on NEAR, enabling us to charge them a fee for the yield generated through this feature.\\\\n\\\\n[//]: # (Why should the committee choose this project?)\\\\nAs mentioned before, we have been one of the first wallets on NEAR and the first multi-chain wallet. Additionally, we were the first wallet to support NEAR Wallet migration. Our dedication to NEAR is evident, and our goal is not only to maintain our wallet and develop new solutions for ourselves but also to advance NEAR\\\\u{2019}s future.\\\\n\\\\nWe aim to develop the NEAR wallet standard. Our objective is to preserve all existing functionalities while transitioning to a wallet standard that supports multiple wallets, similar to how it works on Solana, Sui, or Ethereum (https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-6963). We have already implemented a similar solution for Aptos (https://github.com/aptos-foundation/AIPs/blob/main/aips/aip-62.md). This transition will enhance security, speed, and ease of use. NEAR\\\\u{2019}s current infrastructure requires a robust wallet standard, and we are well-positioned to not only maintain but also enhance it.\\\\n\\\\nAdditionally, Nightly Connect could improve analytics by analyzing traffic and providing more comprehensive data, such as connections with dApps, used wallets, or time spent on dApps.\\\\n## Goals / Milestones\\\\n- We currently have 8,000 WAU (Weekly Active Users) and aim for at least 30% of them to start managing their tokens primarily through Nightly. This means not only holding tokens within our wallet but also taking proactive steps like lending or liquid staking through our \\\\u{201c}Earn\\\\u{201d} tab.\\\\n- Add hardware support to the mobile wallet.\\\\n- Develop support for a Safari extension to make iOS usage even easier.\\\\n- Implement push notifications within the wallet.\\\\n- Develop QR code payments.\\\\n- Develop Nightly Connect on NEAR to assist with gathering data and tracking traffic for dApps and wallets, in line with NEAR\\\\u{2019}s current development approach.\\\\n- Ensure that the NEAR wallet standard built by us will be accepted by all wallets on NEAR.\\\\n- Advance wallet development to achieve full sustainability.\\\\n\\\\n[//]: # (Be sure to communicate what the finished effort looks like.)\\\\nOnce we successfully integrate all our planned activities and develop the new features, we aim to double our user base and ensure that at least 30% of our users engage with NEAR dApps directly via Nightly.\\\\nNightly Connect will be completed, open-sourced, and ready for integration by dApps.\\\\n\\\\n[//]: # (Should include a timeline with milestones, including what will be delivered for each milestone.)\\\\nQuarter 1: Develop the mentioned features (Earn tab, hardware wallet support, Safari extension) and conduct marketing activities to promote these features.\\\\nQuarter 2: Build the new wallet standard for NEAR and pursue business development to encourage all NEAR wallets to implement it. Continue development of existing features within the wallet.\\\\nQuarter 3: Develop Nightly Connect to track dApp and wallet traffic, prepare analytics for this solution, and focus on business development and marketing.\\\\n\\\\n## Metrics\\\\nThe key success metrics we will track are:\\\\n- Total number of unique users using the wallet\\\\n- Total number of unique users using dApp features within the wallet\\\\n- Number of dApps that integrate Nightly Connect\\\\n- Number of wallets that implement the new wallet standard\\\\n\\\\n[//]: # (How will we measure success?)\\\\nWe can track these statistics directly within the wallet. Additionally, we can monitor metrics such as unique users, events conducted within the wallet, users\\\\u{2019} devices, and newly created wallets.\\\\nAfter each quarter, we will prepare a summary of our progress.\\\\n\\\\n## Budget\\\\n$50,000 quarterly, according to https://github.com/near/Infrastructure-Working-Group/discussions/134\\\\n\\\\n[//]: # (Breakdown of funds usage. How will you use these funds? Be specific.)\\\\nAccording to Regular Quarterly Wallet Support Policy #134, we plan to use these funds for operations, maintenance, and continued improvements.\\\\n\\\\nWe will invest in developing the new features mentioned earlier, promote them with our partner dApps, and allocate funds for marketing activities to attract new users to NEAR.\\\\nAdditionally, we will use these funds for the development of Nightly Connect to provide dApps with data analytics tools and to build the Wallet Standard to enhance NEAR\\\\u{2019}s infrastructure.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "3ca104db88eca30ab9a91c47148efe81e855d6793cabf3dec702e9796adba9e4", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "50000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Other"]}

{"id": 17, "body": {"name": "NEAR x IBC Smart Contracts on NEAR", "summary": "At Moonstruck, our goal is to bring the existing implementation of NEAR IBC to a working, production ready state and offer maintenance and support for teams looking to integrate. Furthermore, we would love to work with the NEAR and Cosmos ecosystems and communities to further expand upon this foundation towards a future V2 of this protocol.", "category": "Infrastructure Committee", "timeline": {"status": "REJECTED", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "linked_rfp": null, "supervisor": "trechriron71.near", "description": "## Organization\\\\n\\\\n### Primary person\\\\\\'s contact information\\\\n\\\\n**Strahinja Vukoi\\\\u{10d}i\\\\u{107} (CEO)**  \\\\nTelegram:   @StrahinjaVukoicic  \\\\nEmail:      strahinja@moonstruck.io\\\\n\\\\n### Size of the whole team\\\\n\\\\nMOONSTRUCK has a total of 33 employees, not including external contractors (consultants, auditors, UI/UX experts).\\\\n\\\\n### Size of the engineering team\\\\n\\\\nMOONSTRUCK has a total of 25 engineers available in full time roles.\\\\n\\\\n### Team location\\\\n\\\\nBelgrade, Serbia\\\\n\\\\n### Team background and bios\\\\n\\\\nSelected team member CVs:\\\\n\\\\n- Pavle Batuta \\\\\\\\- [1\\\\\\\\. CV - Pavle Batuta.pdf](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1HC35s5Nz1KS7Xr9NIJsBCfE2JScLm1gt/view?usp=sharing)  \\\\n- Bogdan Ilic \\\\\\\\- [2\\\\\\\\. CV - Bogdan Ilic\\\\u{301}.pdf](https://drive.google.com/file/d/12HmM7oMkYx6rbI7U5a6Ds\\\\\\\\_QqiKo2qsyT/view?usp=sharing)  \\\\n- Emil Bob \\\\\\\\- [3\\\\\\\\. CV - Emil Bob.pdf](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1v5jaqXpRzmbCivydxEyKgiPeGMSPEXN1/view?usp=sharing)  \\\\n- Stefan Latinovic \\\\\\\\- [4\\\\\\\\. CV - Stefan Latinovic\\\\u{301}.pdf](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1E3aahumuXfA\\\\\\\\_\\\\\\\\_wvdhQbOvjJHjxAl65Tu/view?usp=sharing)\\\\n\\\\n### Any affiliations with other NEAR ecosystem partners?\\\\n\\\\nMOONSTRUCK has had an open collaboration with NEAR Balkans Hub for almost 3 years, pretty much from the onset, helping to promote NEAR\\\\u{2019}s technology and ecosystem. Our company facilitated the first ever technical workshop about NEAR for software engineers in Serbia. During the ETH Belgrade and Belgrade Blockchain Week 2023, our company provided a venue for \\\\u{201c}NEAR Day\\\\u{201d} and \\\\u{201c}BOS Workshop\\\\u{201d} held by NEAR\\\\u{2019}s experts.\\\\n\\\\n## Professional Experience\\\\n\\\\n### Examples of relevant experience with NEAR blockchain\\\\n\\\\nMOONSTRUCK has not deployed a production-level project on NEAR blockchain; however, 7 engineers from our company have passed the training in BOS and have experience in building BOS components. Team proposed for this project is very familiar with NEAR architecture and latest technical documentation.\\\\n\\\\n### Non-technical capabilities:\\\\n\\\\nMOONSTRUCK has consistently strived to connect and bring together the Web3 community in the SEE region and participate in various programs to empower teams and individuals, thus cultivating our own talent.\\\\n\\\\n**Web3 Supercluster**  \\\\nMOONSTRUCK is the founding member of Web3 Supercluster, a part of the \\\\u{201c}Serbia Innovates\\\\u{201d} program supported by USAID that seeks to strengthen the Serbian economy through R\\\\\\\\&D collaboration, education and skills development in the deep tech domain.\\\\n\\\\n**Web 2.5 Academy**  \\\\nMOONSTRUCK holds a Web 2.5 Academy, aimed at enabling the inclusion of a wide range of participants with basic programming skills and directing them towards Web3 technologies, providing intrinsic knowledge in blockchain architecture, consensus mechanism, smart contracts and tooling. For the past 2 years, we have held 3 cohorts and trained more than 400 participants.\\\\n\\\\n**Moonwalk**  \\\\nMOONSTRUCK has a four-month internship program Moonwalk, which is designed to bring out the best from a small group of selected candidates from our yearly educational programs.\\\\n\\\\n**Glue**  \\\\nGlue, our Web3 acceleration program, is the premier launchpad for emerging teams and projects, emphasizing technology excellence and hands-on learning process under guidance of our mentors.\\\\n\\\\n**Guesthouse**  \\\\nGuesthouse by MOONSTRUCK is held every year during Belgrade Blockchain Week. It represents a series of side events that cover relevant topics in the Web3 and Blockchain industry. For the past 2 years, we hosted 25 impactful events, engaging over 300 participants in workshops, discussions, presentations, training, etc. With the support from NEAR, Chainlink, ICP, Sui, Superchain and many other valued partners, we brought the Guesthouse event to life.\\\\n\\\\n### Portfolio of relevant work\\\\n\\\\n**Swarm** \\\\\\\\- Decentralised Storage Service by Ethereum Foundation.\\\\n\\\\n**Giveth** \\\\\\\\- Cryptocurrency donation platform and DeFi protocol that rewards donors of verified public goods projects.\\\\n\\\\n**Bitcoin.com** \\\\\\\\- Automated Market Maker (AMM).\\\\n\\\\n**Hundrx** \\\\\\\\- Web3 extension for Twitter (X) enabling tokenization of profiles and enhanced interaction between influencers and followers via social tokens.\\\\n\\\\n**AgAu** \\\\\\\\- RWA digital platform for tokenization of investment gold and precious metals with fully collateralized cryptocurrency.\\\\n\\\\n**DeFire** \\\\\\\\- DEX aggregation platform for transaction optimization.\\\\n\\\\n**Tycoon** \\\\\\\\- Social crypto trading platform and cryptocurrency.\\\\n\\\\n**Renfter** \\\\\\\\- Uncollateralized NFT Renting Protocol.\\\\n\\\\n**Libertas** \\\\\\\\- Infrastructure and Protocol for TSF proof-of-work blockchain (L1).\\\\n\\\\n**Disberse** \\\\\\\\- Transparency on-chain platform for tracking means of public funding.\\\\n\\\\n**Asphodel** \\\\\\\\- Metaverse on-chain game.\\\\n\\\\n**Kamigotchi World** \\\\\\\\- DAO governed on-chain game.\\\\n\\\\n**Mirage Protocol** \\\\\\\\- Universal multichain asset-mirroring protocol.\\\\n\\\\n**TRAKEN** \\\\\\\\- Renewable energy aggregation and trading platform for smart electrical grids based on blockchain technology, enabling power purchasing agreements execution in the form of smart contracts.\\\\n\\\\n## Body\\\\n\\\\nWe propose to inherit the current implementation of the NEAR \\\\\\\\- IBC protocol, previously built by [Octopus Network](https://oct.network/) and prepare it for mainnet production as a version 1.0 release candidate. Furthermore, we would like to offer our services, collaborate with the relevant stakeholders in the Cosmos ecosystem and work towards developing further production releases with new features built in tight cooperation. Finally, we would like to commit a team towards long term maintenance and support of the project \\\\\\\\- including documentation\\\\n\\\\nThe NEAR \\\\\\\\- IBC protocol is the NEAR implementation of the IBC protocol transport layer (IBC/TAO). The project integrates the implementation of the IBC protocol based Inter-Blockchain Communication fungible token transfer application (ICS20) to link the NEAR and Cosmos ecosystems, bringing greater composability to the innovation of the entire interchain blockchain Internet.\\\\n\\\\nMore information on the original project iteration is available on the accompanying [Octopus network Medium post.](https://medium.com/omnity/introduction-to-near-ibc-how-to-implement-the-ibc-protocol-with-smart-contracts-a8b0e13cb886)\\\\n\\\\nOur team has performed an extensive gap analysis and research of the current implementation version and has compiled a [gap analysis report](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1icI44qEgX3srzjx5EJQJs6LJRYy1-H96t4zzwh99\\\\\\\\_28/edit?usp=sharing) with our findings.\\\\n\\\\nWe intend to release the codebase under a permissive open source license. We intend to discuss with the NEAR foundation and any other relevant stakeholders on the exact choice of the license we will be selecting.\\\\n\\\\nThere are currently at least two teams looking to utilize NEAR IBC as a solution. Our goal is to help these initial early adopters to achieve success and build a strong foundation for supporting other teams in the future.\\\\n\\\\n## Goals / Milestones\\\\n\\\\n### Project Goals\\\\n\\\\nWe define two major goals for this proposal: **release** and **maintenance**.\\\\n\\\\nOur **primary release goal** is to prepare a mainnet ready **NEAR IBC v1.0 release candidate** and deploy it into production on time and at quality. The release candidate should \\\\n\\\\n- implement all of the features of the NEAR IBC protocol spec   \\\\n- successfully pass a security audit by a reputable team (or platform).\\\\n\\\\nOur **secondary release goal(s)** are to support teams looking to integrate NEAR IBC into their products and protocols by well produced and detailed developer documentation as well as a working prototype (proof of concept) console based application as a reference.\\\\n\\\\nOur **maintenance goal** is to commit a team to maintain the NEAR IBC project after the release candidate: fix bugs and security issues, prepare new releases, update and maintain documentation and provide first or second line support to teams that are using the protocol as a part of their solutions.\\\\n\\\\nBeyond our immediate goals, we wish to extend the current implementation towards a V2 release with the support of teams in the Cosmos ecosystem. With that in mind, we will ensure that the implementation stays clear and extensible towards future features and upgrades.\\\\n\\\\nTo that end we propose the project be divided into two phases: active development and maintenance cycle.\\\\n\\\\n### Milestones\\\\n\\\\nWe propose the following milestones:\\\\n\\\\n- Alpha release: constitutes a version with a working happy path that can be tested in a local environment  \\\\n- V1 release candidate: constitutes a version with a demonstration PoC that is deployed to a testnet environment and is ready for an audit\\\\n\\\\nThese milestones are based on our current understanding of the project and objectives and priorities. We invite the infrastructure team and the NEAR Foundation to help us define clearer milestones for delivery based on ecosystem priorities and shared understanding.\\\\n\\\\n### Reporting\\\\n\\\\nDuring the **release phase** of the project, we suggest regular **2 week** intervals for reporting on the project status, coinciding with the **end of each working sprint**.\\\\n\\\\nAs part of the report, the team would present (in agreed upon forum and format) the progress of the project, including any demonstration of functionality that can be performed. The project management team will also open a retrospective of the sprint, with the ability to discuss delivery velocity, risks or potential changes of scope.\\\\n\\\\nDuring the **support/maintenance** phase of the project, we suggest **monthly status updates** of work done: security and bug fixes, tech debt resolved, issues reported by the community etc.\\\\n\\\\nWe invite the Infrastructure Board and the NEAR Foundation to help us propose a clear and detailed way of reporting for the project.\\\\n\\\\n### Engineering Estimation\\\\n\\\\nBased on the above gap analysis conclusions, we are able to suggest a provisional delivery scope and provide an expert estimation on engagement with development roles required.\\\\n\\\\n#### Provisional Scope\\\\n\\\\nWe recommend the following scope of work in order to complete the project into a working solution.\\\\n\\\\n##### Required\\\\n\\\\n1. Identify any and all components that need to be replaced from the project  \\\\n2. Determine development/integration/mitigation for the project  \\\\n3. Bring the project into a working state  \\\\n4. Implement a minimal testing framework with essential coverage  \\\\n5. Document a testing procedure for the project and perform smoke testing  \\\\n6. Upgrade the deployment procedure  \\\\n7. Provide documentation to changes  \\\\n8. Deploy solution to testnet  \\\\n9. Scope and implement a minimal PoC (terminal based)\\\\n\\\\n##### Optional\\\\n\\\\n1. Implement a full CI/CD release pipeline  \\\\n2. Implement deployment automation  \\\\n3. Implement full test coverage  \\\\n4. Add static analysis in manual or automated form  \\\\n5. Prepare separate detailed development documentation (for V1)  \\\\n6. Prepare examples for use  \\\\n7. Scope and implement a full PoC Dapp\\\\n\\\\n#### Definition of Done\\\\n\\\\nWe consider the solution as ready for release when it is deployed on a public/available testnet, with released code and artifacts in a state that is ready for audit or early integration. This functionally equates to a testnet release.\\\\n\\\\nThis release constitutes a fully delivered project.\\\\n\\\\nThe release includes a **working PoC** with demonstrable functionality.\\\\n\\\\nThe release does not depend upon audits and integrations with third parties.\\\\n\\\\nMOONSTRUCK will be fully committed to assist with any work required to fix any security issues discovered as well as integration to other projects.\\\\n\\\\n#### Level of Effort and Timeline \\\\\\\\- Development Phase\\\\n\\\\nBased on the provisional scope of the project and the expert estimation we are able to provide a provisional engagement for the project with required roles and effort.\\\\n\\\\nThis project would be handled by a single Agile pod team with the project being their sole focus during the active development phase. Beyond that, experts will be made available to the pod based on task and project requirements. These team members constitute core and support roles:\\\\n\\\\n##### Core Roles\\\\n\\\\n| Role | Responsibilities | Effort |\\\\n| :---- | :---- | :---- |\\\\n| Project Lead, Blockchain Architect | Leadership, reporting, development | Part Time |\\\\n| Blockchain Engineer | Development, testing | Full Time |\\\\n| Blockchain Engineer | Development, testing | Full Time |\\\\n\\\\n##### Support Roles\\\\n\\\\n| Role | Responsibilities | Effort |\\\\n| :---- | :---- | :---- |\\\\n| Engineer in Test | Test automation | Part Time |\\\\n| Technical Writer | Documentation | Part Time |\\\\n| Devops | CI/CD, project deployment | Part Time |\\\\n\\\\n##### Timeline\\\\n\\\\nWe suggest the following timeline for the project, measured in **two week sprints**:\\\\n\\\\n| Sprints | Description | Goals |\\\\n| :---- | :---- | :---- |\\\\n| 1 | Finish gap analysis, perform spikes and fill backlog | Initial task backlog |\\\\n| 2, 3 | Perform smoke testing, write test scenarios, write automated tests, set up initial CI/CD, tech debt analysis | Alpha w/ demonstration capability, basic CI/CD pipeline |\\\\n| 4, 5 | Improved test coverage, tech debt resolution tasks, initial documentation, PoC candidate planning | Basic prototype w/ demonstration capability, documentation, PoC plan |\\\\n| 6 | PoC development, deployment to testnet, developer documentation, examples | Release Candidate: deployed to testnet w/ working PoC |\\\\n\\\\nTotal estimate for delivery of the **proposed scope for V1** amounts to **three months** of effort for the engaged team.\\\\n\\\\n##### Release schedule\\\\n\\\\n| Release | End of sprint | Goal |\\\\n| :---- | :---- | :---- |\\\\n| Alpha | 3 | Local release with a demonstrable happy path available |\\\\n| RC1 | 6 | Fully featured V1 release deployed to testnet with a working PoC |\\\\n\\\\n#### Level of Effort and Timeline \\\\\\\\- Support Phase\\\\n\\\\nAfter the release, we would assign a maintenance team to support the V1 release, ensuring it is working to spec and assisting other development teams with integration. Maintenance will also cover a certain amount of tech debt resolution from the development phase. This role includes redundant effort to ensure availability of support.\\\\n\\\\n##### Support Roles\\\\n\\\\n| Role | Responsibilities | Effort |\\\\n| :---- | :---- | :---- |\\\\n| Blockchain Engineer | Maintenance and support | Part time |\\\\n| Blockchain Engineer | Maintenance and support | Part time |\\\\n\\\\nWe would commit the core support roles to work on maintenance and support tasks for a period of **nine months**.\\\\n\\\\n#### Commentary\\\\n\\\\nMoonstruck wishes to engage and own this project long term. Our goal is to support the expansion of this protocol towards V2 and beyond. Therefore one of the primary outcomes of working on V1 is to get the team acquainted with an expert level of understanding of the underlying protocol, technology and concepts.\\\\n\\\\nOur hope is to reach a level of understanding towards our provisional scope and best-effort analysis as well as continuous improvements towards the protocol with a close relations\\\\n\\\\n## Budget\\\\n\\\\n### Budget Total\\\\n\\\\nWe have estimated the total budget for the project as:\\\\n\\\\n- **USD 98.000** for the development phase (over 3 months)  \\\\n- **USD 72.000** for the support phase (over 9 months)\\\\n\\\\nFor a total of ***USD 170.000*** over a period of 1 year.\\\\n\\\\n### Budget Breakdown\\\\n\\\\nWe suggest the following budget breakdown and payment structure:\\\\n\\\\nFor the development phase we suggest the following payouts:\\\\n\\\\n| Milestone | Time of payment (after project start) | Amount |\\\\n| :---- | :---- | :---- |\\\\n| Alpha | 1.5 months | USD 50.000 |\\\\n| RC1 | 3 months | USD 48.000 |\\\\n\\\\n| Total | USD 98.000 |\\\\n| :---- | :---- |\\\\n\\\\nFor the support phase we suggest the following retainer for the next ***9 months***.\\\\n\\\\n| Item | Recurring | Amount |\\\\n| :---- | :---- | :---- |\\\\n| Engineering Support | Monthly (x9) | USD 8000 |\\\\n\\\\n| Total | 72.000 |\\\\n| :---- | :---- |\\\\n\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "bb5142ca412fb51a03ae4523f8f3dc77047d29e63c1c9e1ad8c5d019a4b64f3d", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "170000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Bridges", "Other"]}

{"body": {"name": "Proposal for Phased Sunsetting of MyNearWallet (MNW) and Maintenance", "summary": "Since March 2023, Meteor Wallet has been enhancing MyNearWallet (MNW) beyond our initial contract, without additional funds. We propose a two-year phased sunsetting to transition users smoothly to other wallets, prioritizing essential maintenance and cost efficiency. This strategy supports the NEAR ecosystem\\\\u{2019}s needs with minimal disruption, and we are prepared to adjust plans based on the Infrastructure Committee\\\\u{2019}s decisions.", "category": "Infrastructure Committee", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": null, "description": "# Proposal for Phased Sunsetting of MyNearWallet (MNW) and Maintenance\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\nThis proposal outlines a plan that balances continued support with a cost-effective approach, including optimization of RPC calls to reduce costs and maintain smooth operations during the transition. However, if the Infrastructure Committee decides to continue MNW\\\\u{2019}s maintenance rather than sunsetting it, we remain open to adapting our approach accordingly.\\\\n\\\\n### Background\\\\n\\\\n- **Initial Contract Duration**: The Meteor team received a 12-month maintenance contract, which has already extended beyond the agreed period, from March 2023 to the current date.\\\\n- [**Work Done to Date**](https://www.notion.so/4851f45e2b1c496ab426146d144d49d5?pvs=21): Here is a monthly breakdown of the completed work.\\\\n- **Provisional Approval**: The Infrastructure Committee has provisionally approved this proposal, with additional stipulations incorporated into this document. These discussions and comments can be reviewed [here](https://github.com/near/Infrastructure-Working-Group/discussions/133).\\\\n\\\\n### **Objectives:**\\\\n\\\\n1. **Feature Reduction**\\\\n    \\\\n    Focus solely on critical maintenance and support for new NEAR Enhancement Proposals (NEPs). We will halt adding new features and instead ensure the wallet remains functional with NEAR\\\\u{2019}s evolving ecosystem.\\\\n    \\\\n2. **Transition Users to Other Wallets**\\\\n    \\\\n    Over time, we will assist MNW users in moving to alternative wallets. This process will be gradual to avoid any disruptions. We will also make sure that features like NEAR lockups are supported so that MNW doesn\\\\u{2019}t create barriers for users switching wallets.\\\\n    \\\\n3. **RPC Call Optimization**\\\\n    \\\\n    RPC calls are an area for potential cost savings and performance improvement. While we cannot guarantee comprehensive changes immediately, we commit to reviewing current RPC usage and exploring optimizations wherever possible. This may include improving the efficiency of these calls or switching to indexers where applicable. \\\\n    \\\\n4. **Security Commitment**\\\\n    \\\\n    Throughout this period, we will respond to any security issues raised by the NEAR Foundation or Pagoda within 24 hours, ensuring MNW remains secure and user funds are protected until the final sunset.\\\\n    \\\\n5. **Phased Sunsetting Approach**\\\\n    - **Year 1:** Begin gradually scaling back non-essential features and assisting users with transitioning their funds to other wallets. We will focus on essential maintenance to keep MNW functional, but new feature updates will be limited.\\\\n    - **Year 2:** Further reduce functionality while encouraging users to migrate to other wallets. The transition will be carefully managed to ensure minimal disruption.\\\\n    - **Final Phase:** A complete transition away from MNW, with full deprecation of the wallet.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n### **Financial Proposal:**\\\\n\\\\n**Budget Reduction:**\\\\n\\\\nDecrease the annual budget from $180,000 to $150,000 for the next 24 months.\\\\n\\\\n**Contract Duration:**\\\\n\\\\nSeptember 2024 to September 2026.\\\\n\\\\n**Payment Structure:**\\\\n\\\\n$37,500 per quarter, paid upfront before each quarter, covering:\\\\n\\\\n- Meteor team oversight (technical resources provided as needed)\\\\n- Support ticketing (e.g., Gleap support ticketing)\\\\n- Operational costs for server and software\\\\n\\\\nThis budget accounts for essential operational expenses, including server fees and software costs required for MNW operations. Any additional costs, such as RPC services or other critical maintenance needs, will require further discussion and potential supplementary support to ensure MNW continues to function optimally.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n### **First Quarter Payment Request:**\\\\n\\\\nTo initiate the execution of this sunsetting plan, we kindly request the release of the first-quarter payment of $37,500.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n### **Conclusion:**\\\\n\\\\nWe remain committed to supporting MNW and the NEAR ecosystem. While we propose a gradual sunsetting of MNW, we are flexible and ready to continue maintaining it if the Infrastructure Committee opts to extend its life. Your support and guidance in this transition are appreciated, and we look forward to working together to ensure the best outcome for the NEAR community.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "web3hedge.near", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "37500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Other"]}

We propose a two-year phased sunsetting to transition users smoothly to other wallets, prioritizing essential maintenance and cost efficiency. This strategy supports the NEAR ecosystem\\\\u{2019}s needs with minimal disruption, and we are prepared to adjust plans based on the Infrastructure Committee\\\\u{2019}s decisions.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=19)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

The transition will be carefully managed to ensure minimal disruption.\\\\n    - **Final Phase:** A complete transition away from MNW, with full deprecation of the wallet.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n### **Financial Proposal:**\\\\n\\\\n**Budget Reduction:**\\\\n\\\\nDecrease the annual budget from $180,000 to $150,000 for the next 24 months.\\\\n\\\\n**Contract Duration:**\\\\n\\\\nSeptember 2024 to September 2026.\\\\n\\\\n**Payment Structure:**\\\\n\\\\n$37,500 per quarter, paid upfront before each quarter, covering:\\\\n\\\\n- Meteor team oversight (technical resources provided as needed)\\\\n- Support ticketing (e.g., Gleap support ticketing)\\\\n- Operational costs for server and software\\\\n\\\\nThis budget accounts for essential operational expenses, including server fees and software costs required for MNW operations. Any additional costs, such as RPC services or other critical maintenance needs, will require further discussion and potential supplementary support to ensure MNW continues to function optimally.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n### **First Quarter Payment Request:**\\\\n\\\\nTo initiate the execution of this sunsetting plan, we kindly request the release of the first-quarter payment of $37,500.\\\\n\\\\n---\\\\n\\\\n### **Conclusion:**\\\\n\\\\nWe remain committed to supporting MNW and the NEAR ecosystem. While we propose a gradual sunsetting of MNW, we are flexible and ready to continue maintaining it if the Infrastructure Committee opts to extend its life. Your support and guidance in this transition are appreciated, and we look forward to working together to ensure the best outcome for the NEAR community.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "web3hedge.near", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "37500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "author_id": "web3hedge.near", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

These discussions and comments can be reviewed [here](https://github.com/near/Infrastructure-Working-Group/discussions/133).\\\\n\\\\n### **Objectives:**\\\\n\\\\n1. **Feature Reduction**\\\\n    \\\\n    Focus solely on critical maintenance and support for new NEAR Enhancement Proposals (NEPs).
